stix:STIX_Header.stix:Title: Phishing Emails Contain Pleasantly Surprised Theme with Gh0st RAT
stix:STIX_Header.stix:Description: On 13 May 2015, a phishing campaign targeted a U.S. Government Department. The emails contained the subject "Pleasantly surprised" and the malicious file Pleasantly surprised.zip (MD5: 688E380A3D896879F5DF8AAB6E6C947D). If the malware is successfully executed it calls out to www.meitanjiaoyiwang.com and sends data.

stix:Indicator.indicator:Description:
This email originated from a compromised Comcast email account.
-----START EMAIL HEADER ----- Received: from resomta-po-06v.sys.comcast.net ([96.114.154.230]) by resqmta-po-04v.sys.comcast.net with comcast id TTLe1q0074yXVJQ01TLec8; Wed, 13 May 2015 15:20:38 +0000 Received: from resmail-po-031v.sys.comcast.net ([162.150.176.41]) by resomta-po-06v.sys.comcast.net with comcast id TTLd1q00N0ty8Ya01TLdZU; Wed, 13 May 2015 15:20:38 +0000 Date: Wed, 13 May 2015 15:20:37 +0000 (UTC) From: [REDACTED] To: [REDACTED] Message-ID: <1109108286.13729607.1431530437121.JavaMail.zimbra@comcast.net> In-Reply-To: <1107663969.13729513.1431530433643.JavaMail.zimbra@comcast.net> Subject: Pleasantly surprised MIME-Version: 1.0 Content-Type: multipart/mixed; boundary="----=_Part_13729603_1641779038.1431530437112" X-Originating-IP: [::ffff:98.126.239.50] X-Mailer: Zimbra 8.0.7_GA_6031 (ZimbraWebClient - FF37 (Win)/8.0.7_GA_6031) Thread-Topic: Pleasantly surprised Thread-Index: xc1UsLp/Xfj0awZSA99KNmUeHcUHCg== DKIM-Signature: v=1; a=rsa-sha256; c=relaxed/relaxed; d=comcast.net; s=q20140121; t=1431530438; bh=RiQ7nHJ7eU1pJbmgo2WLVZ9liMQqlCWj+3mJFADxVo4=; h=Received:Received:Date:From:To:Message-ID:Subject:MIME-Version: Content-Type;  aYHzfcjot71QA== ----- END EMAIL HEADER ----- The email body was blank.
This file saves itself in the temp directory and then deletes itself. This file contains the installer for Gh0st RAT, Pleasantly surprised.exe (MD5: E9B3C7B389AA15C55C7B28A49D606AF4).

Path: C:\Documents and Settings\[USER]\Desktop
If executed successfully, the malware modifies the system registry with configuration values and creates the hidden folder C:\WinRecel to install the files Sys.dat (MD5: 27F1F6F7F37A75134C52F1E06435383E) and air.dll(MD5: 9F364F9FC9BEA84D42E128FA37DE9FE4). It executes air.dll with the following command: "rundll32.exe c:\WinRecel\air.dll LoadEntryPoint"
The installer Pleasantly surprised.exe then removes itself from the user's desktop by executing the following command: "cmd /c ping 127.0.0.1 -n 1&del C:\Documents and Settings\[User]\Desktop\Pleasantly surprised.exe"
Registry Values added: ---------------------------------- HKEY_LOCAL_MACHINE\SYSTEM\ControlSet001\Services\BITS\LoginAddress: PIXeBZjsQcToRZfgSdr0QcXoRZWnSJrkKg== HKEY_LOCAL_MACHINE\SYSTEM\ControlSet001\Services\BITS\LoginPort: yEC9Kg== HKEY_LOCAL_MACHINE\SYSTEM\CurrentControlSet\Services\BITS\LoginAddress: PIXeBZjsQcToRZfgSdr0QcXoRZWnSJrkKg== HKEY_LOCAL_MACHINE\SYSTEM\CurrentControlSet\Services\BITS\LoginPort: yEC9Kg==

When the DLL is executed, it loads the shell code from Sys.dat (MD5: 27F1F6F7F37A75134C52F1E06435383E), creates Sys.inf (MD5: 8ABEA0A2E49E59FE66127BB55B4D427B), and modifies the system registry for persistence by executing "rundll32.exe advpack.dll, LaunchINFSection c:\windows\Temp\Sys.inf,DefaultInstall".

This file makes the following changes: HKEY_LOCAL_MACHINE\SOFTWARE\Microsoft\Windows\CurrentVersion\Run\WinUpdate=rundll32.exe c:\WinRecel\air.dll LoadEntryPoint
This file contains the shellcode for the Gh0st RAT that is required by the installer air.dll (9F364F9FC9BEA84D42E128FA37DE9FE4). When executed, it calls back to www.meitanjiaoyiwang.com.

This file contains the information for the Gh0st RAT. It contained the following strings:
[Version] Signature="$CHICAGO$" [DefaultInstall] AddReg=GameUpdate [GameUpdate] HKLM,Software\Microsoft\Windows\CurrentVersion\Run,WinUpdate,0,"rundll32.exe c:\WinRecel\air.dll LoadEntryPoint"
